channel.title: Diane Larlus's Personal Page
channel.description: Recent content on Diane Larlus's Personal Page

item.title: News
item.description: 2021 Paper accepted at 3DV21: NeuralDiff: Segmenting 3D objects that move in egocentric videos [paper, project page, video] Co-organizing the ImageNet Past, Present, Future workshop at NeurIPS20 Paper accepted at ICCV21: Concept Greneralization in visual representations [project page, video, code] I’m one of the organizers of the PAISS Summer School 2021 (organized by MIAI, PRAIRIE and NAVER LABS Europe) Invited talk at the Women in Computer Vision (WiCV) Workshop at CVPR21 [Video] Invited talk at the ANITI research institute (scientific seminar) 2 papers accepted at CVPR21 Probabilistic Embeddings for Cross-Modal Retrieval [paper, code] Continual Adaptation of Visual Representations via Domain Randomization and Meta-learning (oral) [paper, blog] Area Chair for CVPR21, MVA21, ICCV21, BMVC21 2 papers accepted at WACV21 Unsupervised meta-domain adaptation for fashion retrieval [paper, code, video] StacMR: Scene-Text Aware Cross-Modal Retrieval [paper, code, video] 2020

item.title: Publications
item.description: NeuralDiff: Segmenting 3D objects that move in egocentric videos. Vadim Tschernezki, Diane Larlus, Andrea Vedaldi. 3DV 2021 Concept Greneralization in visual representations. Bülent Sariyildiz, Yannis Kalantidis, Diane Larlus, Karteek Alahari. ICCV 2021 [project page, video] Continual Adaptation of Visual Representations via Domain Randomization and Meta-learning. Riccardo Volpi, Diane Larlus, Gregory Rogez. CVPR 2021 [paper] Probabilistic Embeddings for Cross-Modal Retrieval. Sanghyuk Chun, Seong Joon Oh, Rafael Sampaio de Rezende, Yannis Kalantidis, Diane Larlus.

item.title: Recent talks
item.description: June 2021 Invited talk at the Women in Computer Vision (WiCV) Workshop at CVPR21 - Lifelong visual representation learning [Video] May 2021 Invited talk at the ANITI research institute (scientific seminar) - Learning from weak supervision and mitigating catastrophic forgetting October 2020 Keynote Speaker for MIAI Days - Lifelong visual representation learning August 2020 Invited talk at the ILR Workshop at ECCV20 - From Instance-Level to Semantic Image Retrieval [Video] November 2019 Invited talk at the SOLARIS Workshop - Self-supervised learning for category-level geometry estimation April 2019 Invited talk at the StatLearn 19 conference - Learning Image Representations for Efficient Visual Search November 2018 Invited speaker, AI and Vision session at SophIA Summit - Visual Search July 2018 Lecture at the PRAIRIE Artificial Intelligence summer school (PAISS) [slides] - Visual Search Older: see CV

item.title: Teaching
item.description: 2021/2022 Comprendre des données visuelles à grande échelle - ENSIMAG, Grenoble May 2021 Guest lecture on Visual Search - Hanoi University of Science and Technology (HUST), Vietnam 2020/2021 Comprendre des données visuelles à grande échelle - ENSIMAG, Grenoble 2020 Découvrir l’intelligence artificielle par le jeu (Discover AI with games is a 2 day training session for high school teachers) - Maison pour la Science Alpes-Dauphiné Nov 2019 Lecture on Visual Search as part of the ‘Deep Learning’ course for the MVA master - ENS Paris 2019/2020 Comprendre des données visuelles à grande échelle - ENSIMAG, Grenoble Feb 2019 Lecture on Visual Search as part of the ‘Deep Learning in Practice’ course for the MVA master - ENS Paris 2018/2019 Comprendre des données visuelles à grande échelle - ENSIMAG, Grenoble July 2018 Lecture on Visual Search at the PRAIRIE Artificial Intelligence summer school (PAISS 2018) [slides] Older: see CV

item.title: News
item.description: 2018 Invited speaker, AI and Vision session at SophIA Summit 2018 Paper accepted at ECCV18: Semi-Convolutional Operators for Instance Segmentation [paper] Our work on Capturing the Geometry of Object Categories from Video Supervision has been accepted to TPAMI CVPR18 outstanding reviewer award Lecture about visual search at the PRAIRIE Artificial Intelligence summer school PAISS 2018 Paper accepted at CVPR18: Self-supervised Learning of Geometrically Stable Features Through Probabilistic Introspection (spotlight) [project page, video] Back to the Main Page
